description: Dive into "Visakhapatnam's Picture-Perfect Moments" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Visakhapatnam's Picture-Perfect Moments

places.generalDescription: Rushikonda Beach, located near Vizag, is a picturesque and popular destination known for its curved shoreline, clear waters, and surrounding hills. It's often referred to as the 'Jewel of the East Coast' due to its pristine beauty. The beach offers various water sports such as diving, jet skiing, windsurfing, and swimming. Visitors can also enjoy the tranquil atmosphere away from city life while taking in the stunning views of rocky shores and distant hills.

sources.snippet: If you are looking to spend some relaxed time away from the daily hustle of the metros, RushiKonda Beach, also spelled as Rishikonda beach, is a must-visit. It is a pristine white sand beach situated about 8 km from the Vizag city centre. Both tourists and locals flock to the beach to gaze at the clear blue skies, sunbathe, swim or birdwatch.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Rushikonda Beach: Rushikonda Beach is known for its golden sands and tidy waves. The clear seawater and rocky mountains make it an amazing location for couples to have a pre-wedding photo shoot. Sunrise is the perfect time to capture the beauty of this place for an awe-inspiring photo shoot.
sources.shortName: Top Locations for a Pre and Post-Wedding Photoshoot in VizagNews Hello Vizag

sources.snippet: Rushikonda Beach is another stunning beach in Visakhapatnam, known for its golden sands and crystal-clear waters. It‚Äôs a hotspot for water sports like jet skiing, windsurfing, and swimming. The beach is well-maintained and offers a relaxing environment with beautiful views of the ocean.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Popular as the ‚ÄòJewel of the East Coast‚Äô, this beach will captivate you with its golden shores. It is located in the heart of Rushikonda hill and comes along the best beach places to visit in Vizag.
sources.shortName: 36 Places to Visit in Vishakhapatnam in 2024

places.name: Rushikonda Beach

reviews.text:
In the month of March, I had the opportunity to visit Rushikonda Beach in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, with my close friend Ayush. It turned out to be one of the most enjoyable and refreshing experiences of our trip. Known for its natural beauty and clean shoreline, Rushikonda Beach is truly a gem on the east coast.

The beach was lively yet peaceful, with golden sands and clear blue waters creating a stunning view. The gentle waves and cool breeze made it a perfect spot to relax and unwind. We spent a good amount of time walking along the shore, chatting, and soaking in the serene atmosphere.

What made the experience even better was the scenic drive to the beach. Surrounded by lush greenery and coastal roads, the journey itself was quite beautiful. The beach is also a great place for water sports like jet skiing and surfing, which adds excitement for adventure lovers, though we mainly went there to enjoy the peaceful vibe.

Food stalls near the beach served tasty local snacks, allowing us to enjoy a light meal while enjoying the sea view. The beach was clean and well-maintained, which made our visit even more pleasant.

Overall, Rushikonda Beach is a must-visit destination in Vizag for anyone who loves nature, sea views, and a relaxed vibe. It was a memorable experience that I'd highly recommend to others. I would love to visit again someday.

This is the only beach in Vizag where one can do swimming and also do water sports such as jet ski, speed boat and many more. This is also one of the most popular beaches among tourists. The beach is very lively and there are some good photogenic spots as well.

This is one of the best beaches of Vizag. The    sea current is usually gentle here, with a constant watch from the security, warning tourists venturing little inside the sea. A lot of families with kids and friends in groups make the most of this lovely sea coast playing in the serene beaches, enjoying the water rides, taking lovely photos, riding horses, and kids collecting sea shells.
Note that Scuba diving is open only in winters between Sep through Jan. On the other days, one can enjoy speed boats and speed scooter rides.
Note:
This beach does not have a facility  to shower. The facility that AP tourism provides is mostly non- functional; most of the time, there would be no water. So please make your own arrangements. The support staff at this facility are extremely arrogant and rude. Avoid this place.
There would be numerous photographers reaching out to you for snaps. Be very careful dealing with them.
Also, please be aware that the speed boat driver would usually ask for additional money to take you a little more inside the sea - don't encourage this. This is another trick to fool tourists and make more money.

places.generalDescription: The VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum, located on RK Beach in Visakhapatnam, is a popular tourist attraction. This museum features the INS Kurusura, a Russian-built submarine that was inducted into the Indian Navy in 1969 and decommissioned in 2001 after 31 years of service. It is the first submarine museum in Asia and the second in the world.

sources.snippet: You‚Äôll find the Submarine Museum (or ‚ÄòSmritika‚Äô) standing prominently against the stunning backdrop of Ramakrishna beach. The first of its kind in all of South Asia, the INS (Indian Naval Service) Kurusura Submarine was a Soviet built-I-641 class Submarine, which after 31 years of service was decommissioned and converted into a fascinating museum for the public. There are six guides and a curator to inform and educate visitors about the complex workings of the submarine, and the simple experience of being inside a sub is a thrilling novelty.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Visakhapatnam, India

sources.snippet: For history mixed with photography, you should visit INS Kurusura Submarine Museum which is located inside a submarine that is no longer in use thus it provides a good environment for your photos The images captured by this submarine set against the backdrop of ocean depict what could be seen as artistic Both its narrow passages and vintage equipment creates a unique indoor background suitable for photo shoots This spot is perfect for anyone into industrial and historical photography.
sources.shortName: 10 Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts In Vizag City

sources.snippet: The Submarine Museum, located on RK Beach, is housed in the decommissioned INS Kursura, a Soviet-built submarine of the Indian Navy. It is one of the few submarine museums in the world and offers a unique opportunity to explore the interiors of a submarine. Visitors can learn about the life of naval officers and the operations of a submarine.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Vishakhaptanam, is a port city, built on the coast of the Bay of Bengal, hence, a submarine museum in the city is of little surprise. Set up in 2011, the museum houses the INS Kurusura that was constructed by Russians in the year 1969, reaching India in 1970. It served the Indian Navy greatly until the year 2001, when it was decommissioned.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: The Submarine Museum of Vizag is a submarine itself ‚Äì the INS Kurusura. This Kalvari class submarine of the Indian navy was once operated on both diesel and electricity. After being decommissioned on 27 February 2001, having served in the Indo Pakistani war of 1971, this submarine was preserved for public access at the RK beach in Vizag.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: The Submarine Museum of Vizag is an actual submarine, INS Kurusura, which was decommissioned in 2001. Since then, it has been preserved for public access. With several pictures and artefacts, it gives an insight into the Indian navy.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: The INS Kursura Submarine Museum offers a unique look at naval history. The submarine‚Äôs exterior and interior provide intriguing photo subjects.
sources.shortName: Photography hotspots in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: If you are looking for the best places to visit in Visakhapatnam, then this should not go off your list.
sources.shortName: 36 Places to Visit in Vishakhapatnam in 2024

places.name: VMRDA INS Kursura Submarine Museum

reviews.text:
Must visit the spot. You can get a combo ticket which gives entry to the submarine, aircraft museum and sea harrier. They are all located in walkable distance near RK beach. Try to visit in the evening as it will be cool. There will be air conditioning throughout the tour, so no need to worry about ventilation.

There will be colourful lighting for submarine from the evening which will be a good view from opposite road.

There is no allocated car parking area around, but you can easily find bike parking on the pavement.

INS Kursura Submarine Museum ‚Äì A Fascinating Dive into Naval History

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an absolute must-visit if you're in Visakhapatnam. Stepping inside the actual decommissioned submarine gives a rare and thrilling glimpse into the life of naval officers underwater. It's not just a museum ‚Äì it feels like stepping into a preserved piece of living history.

The submarine itself is compact and impressive. As you move through the narrow corridors and peek into the control rooms, torpedo bays, and sleeping quarters, you can't help but admire the bravery and discipline of the crew who once lived and worked here for months at a time.
The museum staff, many of whom are ex-navy personnel, do an excellent job explaining the submarine's operations and sharing fascinating stories about life under the sea.

From a technical, historical, and emotional perspective, the INS Kursura offers a deeply enriching experience. It's also beautifully maintained, right by the beach, making it a perfect blend of education and a day out by the sea.

Tip: Visit in the evening for a cooler experience and enjoy the illuminated view of the submarine at night!

The INS Kursura Submarine Museum is one of the most fascinating attractions in Vizag and a must-visit for history and defense enthusiasts. Housed inside a real decommissioned submarine, the museum gives visitors a rare opportunity to step into the life of naval officers and sailors who once served at sea.

Walking through the narrow passages, control rooms, and crew quarters offers a deep appreciation of the discipline, courage, and challenges faced by submariners. The displays are informative and well-curated, showcasing the submarine's operations, equipment, and legacy.

The highlight is the chance to experience firsthand the compact living and working conditions inside a submarine, which leaves you with immense respect for the Indian Navy. Its location along RK Beach adds to the appeal, making it easy to combine with a beachside stroll.

Overall, the INS Kursura Submarine Museum is an educational, unique, and memorable experience that offers both adults and children a glimpse into India's rich naval history

places.address: P88J+V2W, RK Beach Rd, Kirlampudi Layout, Chinna Waltair, Pandurangapuram, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530017, India

places.generalDescription: Victory At Sea War Memorial is a seaside park located on Beach Road, dedicated to the Indian naval victory in 1971. It was opened in 1996 to honor the brave navy soldiers who were martyrs in the India-Pakistan war. The memorial commemorates the successful defense of INS Vikrant from a Pakistani submarine attack, which led to India's victory and the creation of Bangladesh.

sources.snippet: Housing an immense variety of fighter plane models, missiles and tankers, the victory at sea war memorial is located in Vizag is a chief tourist attraction of the country. It is a war museum dedicated to the martyrs of Indian defence forces. Its pleasant location in a massive green park and proximity to the beach road intensifies the aesthetic appeal of the place.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: It was built to honour the Indian Navy and soldiers who lost their lives during the 1971 Indo-Pak war. The memorial features an impressive structure with an eternal flame and plaques commemorating the bravery and sacrifice of the soldiers. Surrounded by beautiful gardens, it offers a serene environment for reflection and remembrance.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: 13 km from city center 15 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. This memorial is dedicated to the 'Victory at Sea', during the Indo-Pak war in 1971. A renowned War memorial, it is located in Vizag on the left of the beach road and facing the submarine museum.
sources.shortName: 27 Places to visit in Visakhapatnam 2024

sources.snippet: A glimpse into history, remembering the Indo-Pakistan war of 1971, this memorial was constructed in the year 1996. It was dedicated to the Indian Navy and Eastern Naval Command sailors. A moment of pride will imbibe in you in one visit to this memorial.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

places.name: Victory At Sea War Memorial

reviews.text:
Tall & impressive, this war monument reminds you of the glories of the Indian Navy during the 1971 war.
A telling tribute to our brave soldiers. Can be visited along with various other attractions as it just takes few minutes. Overseas the RK beach and provides good views of the sea.

This monument is a tribute to soldiers who fought for the nation in 1971. It is located on main road near RK beach near Kali Mata temple. Currently the memorial is closed for visitors as there are some renovations going on.

**Peaceful & Patriotic Spot**

A well-maintained war memorial honoring Navy heroes of the 1971 war. Located right on RK Beach, it's free to visit and perfect for a quiet, reflective stop. Great views and a strong sense of pride.

places.address: 31, Beach Rd, Kirlampudi Layout, Chinna Waltair, Pedda Waltair, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530017, India

places.generalDescription: Yarada Beach is a serene and picturesque destination in Visakhapatnam, also known as Vizag. Surrounded by scenic cliffs and offering stunning ocean views, this beach provides a peaceful atmosphere for travelers seeking an escape from city life. The untouched sandy shores and clear waters make it an ideal spot for nature and seascape photography. With hills on three sides, the beach boasts isolated surroundings that are perfect for capturing breathtaking shots.

sources.snippet: Yarada beach is a quieter spot for photography when compared to RK beach. The hills on three sides surround this beach giving it an isolated location with picturesque views The untouched sandy beaches and clear waters make it an ideal place for shooting nature and seascape photographs The surrounding hills are great vantage points from where you can take the photographs in different angles Sunrise or sunset especially at Yarada Beach during golden hour gives a magical experience for both sunrise and sunset with soft lighting to enhance the natural beauty of the area.
sources.shortName: 10 Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts In Vizag City

sources.snippet: Vizag is dotted with many beaches along its coastline, with the most famous one being the Yarada Beach. One of the most stunning places to see in all of Visakhapatnam, Yarada beach is surrounded by majestic hills on three sides, and by the Bay of Bengal on the other side. One of the best things about Vizag‚Äôs beaches is that they are a lot cleaner and a lot less crowded than other famous beaches along the Indian coastline, and Yarada beach is no exception.
sources.shortName: Tourism | Visakhapatnam District, Government of Andhra Pradesh

sources.snippet: Located near Gangavaram Port, Yarada Beach is crowded and best suited for a pre-wedding photoshoot at Vizag. The fine sand and rocky cliffs give the best panoramic shots, the entire area is covered with hundreds of banana and coconut plantations making it an absolutely beautiful location for a pre-wedding shoot. It has no entry fees, the best time to visit is during the day and it is usually crowded on Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday.
sources.shortName: Top 15 places to have a pre-wedding photo shoot at Vizag

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach, near Gangavaram Port, is busy and ideal for a pre-wedding photoshoot in Vizag. The fine sand and rugged cliffs provide the ideal panoramic photos, and the area is surrounded by hundreds of banana and coconut plantations, making it an extremely stunning location for pre-wedding photography. There are no admission prices, and the ideal time to come is during the day.
sources.shortName: Top Shooting Locations in Visakhapatnam To Visit

sources.snippet: Another popular attraction in Vizag, Yarada beach is one of the well maintained beaches of the city. The golden sand and pristine waters at the beach makes it one of best places in Vizag to spend some memorable moments with your loved ones. The picturesque beauty of the surroundings and breathtaking views of sunrise and sunset will leave you awestruck.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: About 15 kilometres from the city of Visakhapatnam lies the Yarada Village, the coast of which formulates the stunning Yarada Beach. The Bay of Bengal borders the beach and gives it a serene outlook. On the other three sides, towering hills border the beach, making it a calm and peaceful sanctuary for tourists and locals alike.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach is a hidden gem that is well-known for its peaceful surroundings and fine sands. This beach, which is surrounded by hills, is ideal for couples looking for a more private location for their wedding picture shoot. The breathtaking vistas of the ocean and the verdant surroundings provide the ideal setting.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Visakhapatnam: A Romantic Guide

sources.snippet: This beach offers a fabulous landscape with its exotic blend of golden sands and the lush green stretch of hills. Nestled between the hills on all the three sides and the Bay of Bengal on one side, this beach is an ideal spot for outing. Unlike RK Beach, this beach is not commercialized much.
sources.shortName: 23 Places to Visit near Vizag (Visakhapatnam) within 200 kms (2025)

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach: Yarada Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Vizag. Located near Gangavaram Port, it boasts fine sand and rocky cliffs, providing a perfect panoramic shot. Hundreds of coconut plantations add to its beauty, making it a great location for a pre and post-wedding shoot.

sources.snippet: 6 km from city center 5 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. Situated on the coast of the Bay of Bengal and located close to Dolphin's nose, the Yarada beach is a quiet beach to chill by the waves, sip that tender coconut water and occasionally play in the water.
sources.shortName: 27 Places to visit in Visakhapatnam 2024

sources.snippet: A secluded haven for nature lovers and peace seekers, Yerada beach is one of the famous Visakhapatnam tourist places. This serene beach is cuddled between towering hills on three sides and the mighty Bay of Bengal on the fourth. What else can be more picture-perfect?.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Surrounded by magnificent hills on its three sides and Bay of Bengal on the fourth, Yarada Beach is undoubtedly the best beach in Vizag. The beach is clean and the golden sands add to its beauty. Sunrise and sunset views are mind blowing.
sources.shortName: 8 Stunning Places To Visit In Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Click beautiful shots of the setting sun just as the sky turns orange, and the sea turns grey. Even better if you bring someone along to click those stunning artsy silhouette shots to put as your display.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Places To Check Out In Vizag

sources.snippet: Flanked by banana and coconut plantations against the backdrop of rocky hills, Yarada Beach is just the place to be if you want to seek solace from the fast-paced city life.
sources.shortName: 36 Places to Visit in Vishakhapatnam in 2024

sources.snippet: Yarada Beach is less crowded and offers pristine sands and clear waters. It‚Äôs an ideal spot for serene and peaceful photos.
sources.shortName: Photography hotspots in Visakhapatnam

places.name: Yarada Beach

reviews.text:
Visited Yarada Beach with my friend Ayush during our Vizag trip, and it was an unforgettable experience! The drive to the beach was a bit risky - winding roads and sharp turns made it quite the adventure - but totally worth it for the breathtaking view that awaited us.
We spent a relaxing two hours there, soaking in the natural beauty and sipping on some of the biggest and freshest coconuts we've ever had! ü••‚òÄÔ∏è The beach is clean, peaceful, and offers a perfect escape from the city buzz.
Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind with a scenic backdrop! Just be cautious on those roads. üòâ

Yarada is a beautiful long beach, with coconut grooves and dense hills on one side.
Good for long walks, quality time with family and kids or picnic.
Actual beach front is steep, not recommend for bathing due to safety reasons.
Not much of commercialization, no shacks, no restaurants.
It's painful to see such a beautiful beach surrounding littered with polythenes and bottles.

The drive to reach this beach is fairly decent, with accessible roads and manageable traffic. However, the beach itself is quite disappointing. Cleanliness is severely lacking, and the water quality is poor, making it an unappealing spot for visitors.

Swimming is not allowed, as there are multiple warning signs citing dangerous depths, which further limits the recreational appeal of this place. Overall, it's one of the worst beach experiences I've had.

I sincerely hope the local authorities take action to improve the condition of the beach-both in terms of cleanliness and safety-so it can become a more enjoyable destination in the future.

places.generalDescription: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a popular tourist destination located on the Gangavaram port of Vizag, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city and ocean. The name is derived from the large rock viewpoint that resembles a dolphin's nose shape. This 174-meter-high headland provides stunning vistas of the coastline and lush green hills.

sources.snippet: One of Visakhapatnam‚Äôs most beloved tourist spots, Dolphin‚Äôs Nose, is truly a sight to behold. The name is derived from the shape of the large rock formation itself, which does resemble a dolphin‚Äôs nose in profile when viewed from afar. At an altitude of 174 meters above sea level, you‚Äôll be able to catch fascinating views of the bustling city at one end, and at the other you can watch the serene comings and goings of ships along the coast.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Visakhapatnam, India

sources.snippet: Dolphin‚Äôs Nose Lighthouse is situated on a hill shaped like a dolphin‚Äôs nose, offering stunning views and one of the best things to do in Visakhapatnam and the coastline. Standing at 174 metres above sea level, the lighthouse is a crucial landmark for navigation. It is surrounded by lush greenery and provides a calm environment for visitors.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Close to Gangavaram Beach lies an absolutely beautiful picnic spot, favourited by Vizag locals over weekends. Dolphin‚Äôs Nose is a hilltop that provides a fresh atmosphere filled with greenery and trees. There is a lighthouse in Dolphin‚Äôs Nose that you must climb to get the most stunning views of the landscape nearby.
sources.shortName: 23 Awesome Picnic Spots in and Around Vizag

sources.snippet: Dolphin‚Äôs Nose: Dolphin‚Äôs Nose is a must-visit place in Vizag, thanks to its scenic beauty, soothing environment, and surreal setting. The sunset view from this place makes it a picture-worthy location for photoshoots. It's an excellent spot to have a mesmerizing photo shoot with a jaw-dropping background.

sources.snippet: A hill that resembles a dolphin‚Äôs nose in its shape is another popular tourist spot in Vizag called the Dolphin‚Äôs Nose. There is a lighthouse that guides sailing ships to the port and away from harsh regions of the sea. It was used by the British before the independence of India as a military camp.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: Owing to its scenic beauty, soothing environment, and surreal setting, Dolphin‚Äôs nose has become a must-visit place. The sunset view from this place makes it a picture-worthy location for photoshoots. It is the best place to have a mesmerizing photo shoot with a jaw-dropping background.
sources.shortName: Top 15 places to have a pre-wedding photo shoot at Vizag

sources.snippet: Dolphin‚Äôs Nose is a well-known landmark in Vizag that provides expansive views of the coastline. The neighboring cliffs and lighthouse make for an amazing photo backdrop. The ideal times to take pictures here are in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid direct sunlight.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Visakhapatnam: A Romantic Guide

sources.snippet: 4 km from city center 7 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. Very similar to a dolphins nose, this 174 m high rocky headland is situated in the south of Vizag . The nose seems to be protruding out towards the Bay of Bengal giving it a rather fascinating look.
sources.shortName: 27 Places to visit in Visakhapatnam 2024

sources.snippet: Situated right on top of the sea is this Dolphin-like rock headland of prominence as a calf. This place provides amazing views of the city and its coastline. It is highly sought after by photographers, especially at sunrise and sunset.

sources.snippet: Having a pre-wedding shoot at this location will make your photos stand out. This is the best place for a scenic photo shoot.

places.name: Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse

reviews.text:
It is a must visit place in vizag. The experience is amazing. The view is breathtaking. The timings are restricted from 3PM - 5PM only, so plan accordingly.

It is located towards the south of vizag, roughly 25km from RK beach. The way goes through industrial areas, military areas and a steep ghat road. The ghat road journey can be a little tough with sharp turns, speed breakers, steep road and bumpy patches.

Once you reach the entrance, there is a good parking area and you can buy the entry ticket. From there you need to walk around 200-300m to the main lighthouse. From there you need to climb around 70 normal steps and 10-12 steps in a ladder to reach the top.

The view is just breathtaking and very wholesome. The wind will be strong, so take care of your belongings. And walk slowly as there is less area to roam on the top. Cellphone signals will be weak here.

Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse, perched atop Dolphin's Nose hill (Yarada Hills) in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is an iconic maritime landmark offering breathtaking coastal views and historical significance.

You can come here via public transport which is very less to this place or via private vehicles (recommend).
I went here via scooty which gives an amazing experience.
A few places are available for the public as most of the place is acquired by the Indian Navy.
The place is full of historical and cultural significance.
At main enty a fee of 10 will be collected and vehicle details would be captured.
Timing of this place is very much crucial so be on time that is 3-5pm
You will get an amazing experience with mesmerizing view.
One more thing. However there is a small shop and bathroom but if possible bring your own thing with you.

The Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is one of Vizag's hidden gems and absolutely worth a visit. Perched on a rocky headland, the lighthouse offers a spectacular panoramic view of the coastline and the vast Bay of Bengal. The sweeping sight of the blue waters meeting the rugged shoreline is truly breathtaking and makes the climb worthwhile.

The area around the lighthouse is calm and less crowded, which adds to the charm. It's a great spot for photography, relaxation, or simply soaking in the refreshing sea breeze. The vantage point also gives visitors a unique perspective of Vizag's natural beauty, blending hills, sea, and port views all in one frame. Do take note of the visiting time on the day of your visit. Its 3pm-5pm.
Security is kind of strict in the area for obvious reasons.

For those exploring the city, the Dolphin's Nose Lighthouse is a must-visit destination to experience the scenic grandeur of the coast

places.address: Dolphin Hill, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530005, India

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hillside in Visakhapatnam, Ross Hill Church offers stunning views of the sea and port. This popular tourist spot is known for its beautiful white exterior and attracts both religious followers and tourists alike due to its impressive architecture. Visitors can explore the church's interior and attend prayers, making it a must-visit destination in Andhra Pradesh.

sources.snippet: Ross Hill Church stands on top of Ross Hill, which is the highest peak within Vizag. This church provides panoramic views overlooking the city and harbor while not only serving as a religious structure for worshiping purposes. The church's colonial architecture contrasts sharply with its surroundings making it an interesting subject matter for architectural photographers who want something distinctive from their usual shots.
sources.shortName: 10 Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts In Vizag City

sources.snippet: Surrounded by three hills, each having a distinguishing religious significance Vizag has got a rich cultural heritage. Situated on top of the central hill is the Ross Hill Church, an impressive structure in Vizag that should not be missed by anyone visiting this beautiful port city. The best part of visiting Ross Hill Church is the panoramic view of the city and the horizon is sure to amaze you.
sources.shortName: Top 15 places to have a pre-wedding photo shoot at Vizag

sources.snippet: The Ross Hill Church, perched atop the central hill, is an outstanding structure in Vizag that should not be missed by anyone visiting this lovely port city. The panoramic view of the city and the horizon is undoubtedly the nicest part of visiting Ross Hill Church. This is a must-see if you want to see picture-perfect dawn or sunset.

sources.snippet: Have a picnic while experiencing major religious overtones in Ross Hill. The place is famous in Vizag for the harmonious co-existence of a church, a mosque and a temple in the same location. At the foothills visit the mosque and the temple and then climb atop Ross Hill where there is a picturesque church.

sources.snippet: Ross Hill Church is a historic church located on Ross Hill, offering panoramic views of Visakhapatnam city and the harbour. The church is known for its beautiful architecture and serene environment. Built during the colonial period, it has a rich history and is an important landmark in the city.

sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Tenneti Park, Divis Beach, Rose Hill Church, and Bheemili Beach are some of the most romantic locations in Vizag that offer the perfect setting for a pre and post-wedding photoshoot. Plan your photoshoot at these locations and create memories that will last a lifetime.
sources.shortName: Top Locations for a Pre and Post-Wedding Photoshoot in VizagNews Hello Vizag

sources.snippet: Ross Hill is a beautiful hilltop in Vizag from which a temple, a church and a mosque are visible. It is along the naval dockyard which serves as a great background for your photographs. The backwaters are also a part of the aesthetic view from the church hilltop.
sources.shortName: Picture perfect locations in Vizag for a romantic pre-wedding photoshoot

sources.snippet: The next destination to explore when you are in Visakhapatnam for 3 days is Ross Hill Church. It is a popular religious landmark that adorns a beautiful architecture with a serene vibe to make you feel happy and positive from inside.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Visakhapatnam (Places to Visit in Three Days)

places.name: Ross Hill Church

reviews.text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Rose Hill Church is hands-down one of the most breathtaking spots in the city! üåä‚õ™ Sitting high on the hill, the church itself is peaceful and charming, but the real magic begins when you step outside and look at the view. The entire coastline opens up in front of you - you can literally watch huge cargo ships, cruise liners, and even naval vessels passing by. If you're lucky, you might catch a submarine surfacing or a naval practice session happening right in the ocean below. It feels like a live maritime show! üö¢‚öì

The place is super calm, with a refreshing sea breeze and plenty of open space to just sit, relax, and take it all in. It's perfect for photography, quiet reflection, or just watching the world (and ships!) go by. Early mornings and evenings are the best time to visit - the light makes everything look golden and magical. üåÖ

Whether you're a tourist or a local, Rose Hill Church is a must-visit if you love scenic views, history, and the ocean. Highly recommended! üëç

Ross Hill Church, perched high above Visakhapatnam's harbor, is more than just a religious site-it's a serene retreat with one of the best views in the city. The church itself is modest but well-kept, offering a calm and quiet atmosphere perfect for reflection or a moment of silence. What sets this spot apart is the stunning vantage point. From the church grounds, you can look out over the port, city skyline, and coastline. It's especially beautiful at sunset, when the light spills over the hills and sea. The journey up the hill, though a bit steep, is worth every step for the peaceful environment and the views.

Rose Hill Church is a serene and picturesque destination located at the top of a hill, offering a peaceful escape from the daily hustle. The uphill walk takes around 10 minutes and is fairly manageable, though a bit of a workout. For those who prefer a more comfortable ascent, autos are readily available at the base of the hill, and you can also drive up with your own vehicle.

The view from the top is absolutely stunning - a panoramic sweep of the surrounding area that makes the climb worthwhile. What makes this spot even more special is the presence of not just the church, but also a mosque and a shrine nearby, all coexisting peacefully on the same hill. It adds a unique spiritual and cultural charm to the place.

Whether you're looking to spend some quiet time in reflection, take in the view, or just enjoy a peaceful walk, Rose Hill Church is a great spot to unwind. Highly recommended for a relaxing outing.

places.address: M7RP+5RH, Port Area, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530001, India

places.generalDescription: Thotlakonda Buddhist Monastery is a historical site located on a hillock 15 km from the main city of Vizag. The complex holds cultural significance and features rock-cut inscriptions. Its proximity to the sea and sub-tropical climate made it an ideal location for monks to build the monastery.

sources.snippet: The Thotlakonda Buddhist Complex is set on a hilltop and is an ancient site that dates back to 3rd century BCE. Ruins of stupas, viharas, or other structures are quite interesting for the architectural photographer and provide good opportunities to take photographs for such purposes. Such hilltop locations have picturesque views over these landscapes as well as the sea which makes it an ideal location to capture historical scenes along with scenery.
sources.shortName: 10 Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts In Vizag City

sources.snippet: Also known as 'the Hill of Eagles', the complex has a number of stupas, Chaityas, Viharas, a congregation hall and a refectory belonging to the Hinayana school, mostly excavated during1982-92. These remains are classifieds as religious, secular and civil. Excavations at Thotlakonda comprise pottery, beads, bangle pieces, tiles, stuccos, iron objects, sculptural remains, moulded bricks, inscriptions, coins, etc.
sources.shortName: 23 Places to Visit near Vizag (Visakhapatnam) within 200 kms (2025)

sources.snippet: If you are the one who loves adding heritage sites to their photos, you should definitely add Thotlakonda to your list. This archeological site has Buddhist stupas and structures constructed 2000 years ago. Add a hint of history to your pictures with the unusual design of the place.
sources.shortName: 6 non-beach spots that are popular choices for photoshoot in Vizag

sources.snippet: Thotlakonda: Thotlakonda is a historical Buddhist site that was discovered in the 1970s. It is located on a hilltop overlooking the Bay of Bengal, providing stunning views of the sea. The site is surrounded by lush green forests, which add to the charm of the location.
sources.shortName: Top Locations for a Pre and Post-Wedding Photoshoot in VizagNews Hello Vizag

sources.snippet: Thotlakonda offers ancient stupas and monasteries with serene views. The site is perfect for capturing both historical and natural scenes.
sources.shortName: Photography hotspots in Visakhapatnam

places.name: Thotlakonda Buddhist Monastery

reviews.text: Very peaceful, not a lot of crowd. Well maintained space. Route is scenic and the guard was helpful and explained the history of the place. Original stupa was lost and restored later, but the layout of the place remains and was a nice experience to witness the beauty of this place. You can see the sea from here too.

This monastery used to be inhabited by monks thousands of years ago and the ruins are since then. The entry fee is quite minimal. There is a nice view point here which gives you panoramic views of the city and shoreline.

I really enjoyed the thotlakonda monastery ruins. Free entrance although you need to pay some charges while entering the road which leads to this. The signboards are quite informative and the place is free from guides. So you can just explore the beautiful and peaceful place on your own, the little signboards provide enough information to enjoy the place. The signboard outside gives a brief history of the place as well. Easily can covered in half an hour as the place is not very big.

places.generalDescription: Bheemili Beach is a renowned destination in Visakhapatnam, situated at the meeting point of the Bay of Bengal and Gosthani River. Unlike other beaches in the area, it offers calm waters and a peaceful atmosphere, making it an ideal escape from city life. Visitors can explore historical remnants dating back to the 17th century, providing insights into the Dutch era. The beach's picturesque setting with clear blue waters and golden sands makes it perfect for nature lovers and adventure seekers.

sources.snippet: A little beach settlement at river Gosthani, Bheemili Beach is a local weekend picnic spot. It has a clean, secluded beach that houses playful statues of various religious figures like the Pandavas and meditating Buddhist monks. Visit the 17th-century Dutch cemetery which has unique pyramid-shaped tombs.
sources.shortName: 23 Awesome Picnic Spots in and Around Vizag

sources.snippet: 34 km from city center 14 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. The long beautiful and pristine Bheemunipatnam Beach is located at the assemblage of Gosthani River and the Bay of Bengal. It also houses the remains of a 17th century fort and cemetery, reveling history dating back to the Dutch era.
sources.shortName: 27 Places to visit in Visakhapatnam 2024

sources.snippet: At a distance of 32 km from Vizag Railway Station, 377 km from Vijayawada, 227 km from Rajahmundry & 628 km from Hyderabad, Bheemunipatnam popularly known as Bheemili is famous for a picturesque beach. It is located at the mouth of the river Gosthani which merges with Bay of Bengal at Bheemunipatnam.

sources.snippet: Just a few kilometers from the outskirts of Vizag, Bheemili Beach is located near Bheemunipatnam. Bheemili Beach provides a beautiful seafront, thatched cottages and ancient Dutch bungalows that are a reminder of its rich cultural past.

sources.snippet: Bheemili Beach is located in Bheemunipatnam, a historic suburb of Visakhapatnam. The beach is known for its calm waters and pristine sands. It has historical significance with remnants of Dutch and British colonial architecture.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

places.name: Bheemili Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach with a small park up front and a few fast food stalls. Peaceful place and a good open road ride, free of city traffic towards the beach. Photographers at the beach are the most annoying things there. They won't leave you the whole time.

Unlike bustling city beaches, Bheemili offers a quiet and tranquil atmosphere, ideal for relaxation.¬†The beach boasts golden sands and calm waters, making it perfect for enjoying the sea.
There may be limited options for restaurants and hotels in the immediate area, so it's advisable to carry food and water.

Why Bheemli Beach is a Must-Visit:

1. Scenic Drive: The 25-30 km ride from Vishakhapatnam Beach Road to Bheemli is breathtaking, with lush greenery, towering trees, and majestic mountains on one side and the sea on the other.
2. Thrilling Ride: Riding a scooty adds to the thrill of the journey, making it an exhilarating experience.
3. Serene Beach: Bheemli Beach is a peaceful escape, with smaller stones and fewer crowds, making it perfect for relaxation.
4. Natural Beauty: The beach is surrounded by natural beauty, with the sea on one side and mountains on the other, creating a unique and picturesque landscape.
5. Peaceful Atmosphere: The beach is ideal for those seeking a tranquil getaway, away from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Overall, Bheemli Beach is a hidden gem near Vishakhapatnam, offering a unique blend of natural beauty, adventure, and relaxation.

places.generalDescription: Indira Gandhi Zoological Park, located just 17 kilometers from Vizag, is one of Asia's largest wildlife parks spread over 625 acres of Kambalakonda Reserve Forest. The park showcases a diverse range of animals, including white tigers, panthers, spotted deer, and various primate species in naturalized enclosures. Visitors can explore the park through guided safaris to gain insights into the unusual fauna and participate in conservation education initiatives.

sources.snippet: Spread across a vast expanse of 625 acres, this zoological park is named for Indira Gandhi, the former Prime Minister of India. The park is surrounded by the Eastern Ghats on three sides, while the Bay of Bengal flows along the fourth. The zoo provides natural ambiance and habitats for its wildlife and birdlife, and currently houses over 80 different species.
sources.shortName: Top Things To See And Do In Visakhapatnam, India

sources.snippet: Situated in the Kambalakonda area of Visakhapatnam, the Indira Gandhi Zoological Park is the best tourist attraction in Vizag for people who love wildlife and nature. Being one of the best places to see in Vizag, it attracts thousands of visitors every year and offers views of eastern Ghats on its three sides and the Bay of Bengal on the fourth.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: 16 km from city center 10 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. The Indira Gandhi Zoological Park is located amidst the Kambalakonda Reserve Forest in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Declared open to the public on 19 May 1977, the Park now offers a number of exhibits of more than 80 species of mammals, birds and reptiles.

sources.snippet: The two best places to visit in a new city are its museums and zoological parks. It is a favourite destination for children and animal lovers of all ages.

sources.snippet: You cannot conclude your Visakhapatnam tour without paying a visit to the Gandhi Zoological Park. Located in the Kambalakonda reserve forest, it has a rich variety of flora and fauna. Elephants, jaguar, deer, vulture, and hippos are just some of the animals you can find here.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Indira Gandhi Zoological Park occupies a sprawling 625 acres of land. The location of the zoo is mesmerizing as you find hills on both the sides of the zoo and Bay of Bengal to its east. Located in such a natural setting, the zoo appears very much a home to wildlife.
sources.shortName: 8 Stunning Places To Visit In Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Blending environment and wildlife, the Indira Gandhi Zoological Park is a wonderful venue for couples. The rich vegetation and varied flowers provide a striking background for pictures. Check the zoo for any limitations on photography, though.

sources.snippet: Housing more than 80 species of birds, mammals and reptiles, this park is one of the significant places to visit in Visakhapatnam. It is located within the Kambalakonda Reserve Forest.
sources.shortName: 36 Places to Visit in Vishakhapatnam in 2024

places.name: Indira Gandhi Zoological Park

reviews.text:
Indira Gandhi Zoological Park in Visakhapatnam is a must-visit destination for wildlife enthusiasts and families. Spread across 625 acres, it's one of the largest zoos in India, housing around 843 animals from 123 species.

- *Natural Setting*: The zoo is nestled in the Eastern Ghats, providing a natural habitat for the animals.
- *Variety of Animals*: Visitors can spot tigers, lions, elephants, giraffes, and various bird species.
- *Conservation Efforts*: The zoo is involved in breeding programs for endangered species like the Asiatic wild dog.
- *Educational Programs*: The zoo offers educational activities and workshops for children and adults.
- *Food Options*: Some visitors have reported limited food options within the zoo.
- *Crowd Management*: The zoo can get crowded, especially on weekends and
- *Plan Ahead*: Check the zoo's timings and entry fees before visiting.
- *Wear Comfortable Shoes*: The zoo is spread over a large area, so wear comfortable shoes for walking.
- *Bring Water and Snacks*: While there are food options available, it's a good idea to bring

The zoo was completely clean and well maintained. I saw animals like Tiger, Lion, jackals, crocodiles, cheetah, deer, elephants, various types of birds and many more. I went in a cool weather which made the place look more attractive. Animals are being taken care properly by the authorities. Inside there are places to have ice cream, tea or coffee. The place is worth visiting for wildlife lovers.

Vizag Zoo Park
We recently visited Vizag Zoo Park with our family, and it was a wonderful experience! We saw a wide variety of animals including tigers, white tigers, elephants, giraffes, crocodiles, snakes, lions, deer, and even an anaconda. The kids were especially excited to see the different species of birds, peacocks, and tortoises.

We chose to explore the entire zoo on foot, which allowed us to enjoy the natural beauty and greenery all around. It was a refreshing and peaceful walk, and a great way to connect with nature while learning about wildlife.

We also visited the butterfly zone, which looked nice, but unfortunately there were no butterflies at the time. That was a bit disappointing, but overall it didn't take away from the experience.

The zoo is well-maintained and perfect for a family outing. My kids really enjoyed everything, and we had a great time together. Highly recommended for a fun and educational day out in nature

places.generalDescription: Thotlakonda Beach, located near Bheemli Beach, derives its name from the nearby Thotlakonda Buddhist Complex. The beach is characterized by rocky formations and offers a serene and secluded atmosphere, making it a pleasant alternative to the more crowded Rushikonda Beach. Visitors can explore the rock cave arch and capture stunning photographs reminiscent of locations outside India. The beach features a mix of rocky and sandy shores, providing ample opportunities for picturesque views.

sources.snippet: Don‚Äôt be surprised if you see long red flowing saree pallus here. This beach is popular for photo shoots and movie shootings. With the natural arch present here, it is the perfect choice for a pre-wedding shoot.

reviews.text: The beach is so clean and less crowded. Main attraction is the natural arch. That is really beautiful and photogenic.

Thotlakonda beach is famous for its Natural Arch..
It is one of the beautiful beaches of Visakhapatnam..
You must visit this place to witness the sunset..

Most of the part of this beach is rocky. Yet it is one of the cleanest beaches. The crowd is less here, it is peaceful and there is a dedicated parking space also which is free of cost. Had a great time here.

places.generalDescription: Kambalakonda Eco Park is a remarkable wildlife sanctuary and eco-tourism park abundant with dense evergreen forest and diverse fauna. Situated near Vizag, it serves as an ideal destination for nature enthusiasts. The park offers an array of thrilling activities such as forest trekking, boating, and birdwatching. It is highly recommended for friends and families seeking a superb getaway amidst serene surroundings.

sources.snippet: This is a wildlife sanctuary and eco-tourism park full of wet evergreen forest and wildlife. It is one of the most amazing places to visit near Vizag. Forest trekking, boating and birdwatching are popular activities here.

places.name: Kambalakonda Eco Park

reviews.text: Nice place and best picnic spot. But please avoid plastic bottles and also plastic related items.

While the greenery at Kambalakonda is a pleasant sight, the park is currently underwhelming due to ongoing development works. Many promised attractions are unavailable, making it feel like a work in progress. It's a nice place for a quiet walk, but not much more.
A peaceful getaway just outside Vizag, Kambalakonda offers lush greenery, scenic trekking trails, and light adventure activities like ziplining and kayaking.

places.generalDescription: Lawsons Bay Beach Park, also known as Pedawaltair Beach, is a hidden gem located 8-9 km from Vizag city center. It offers a quieter atmosphere and pristine sands, making it perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and long beach walks away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The beach provides beautiful scenery and a cold sea breeze for ultimate relaxation. With crystal clear waters and warm soothing waves, it's an ideal spot for swimming.

sources.snippet: 14 km from city center 16 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. Lawson's Bay beach is considered an extension of Ramakrishan beach more than often. It is a calm, serene and secluded stretch with lush greenery and whitish sands.

sources.snippet: Lawson‚Äôs Bay Beach: One of the few beaches to allow surfing and swimming, this beach is a must-visit. Its crystal clear blue waters and white sandy beaches house seagulls that make it look even more beautiful.

places.name: Lawsons Bay Beach Park

reviews.text: It is a great place to bring young kids. It has many play facilities along with outdoor gym equipment installed. It is clean inside the part. The municipality has to take steps to clear the beach area as it is very dirty outside due to an open drain left into the sea. Over all a nice place to take an evening stroll.
Lots of space to go around. Nice sit outs spread all over. Kids play area. Open gym. Walking track with good greenery. But some times bit foul smell from sea side. But overall well maintained.
The park is good for walking and less crowded.But the beach nearby is the dirtiest beach of visakhapatnam.

places.generalDescription: Visakha Museum, situated in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is a cultural treasure trove housed in a restored 19th-century Dutch bungalow. The museum showcases a diverse collection of regional relics and exhibits that depict India's naval history. Visitors can explore ancient sculptures, coins, photographs, and model ships and submarines that narrate the evolution of Visakhapatnam from a fishing village to a bustling port city.

sources.snippet: Visakha Museum, also known as the Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation Museum, showcases the history and culture of Visakhapatnam. The museum houses a wide range of artefacts, including weapons, sculptures, historical documents, and models of warships. It provides a comprehensive overview of the region‚Äôs maritime history and cultural heritage.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Better known as the Visakhapatnam municipal corporation museum, the  Visakha museum is a port city museum housing treasures from ancient history and artefacts if the Kalingadhara region. The museum was opened to the public in 1991 and since then, has been a popular tourist spot of Vizag.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: If you want to explore more museums, you could visit the Vishakha Museum. The museum is dated back to about 260 BC, tracing through the history of the city and depicting the various aspects of culture that the city inhabits.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: The Visakha Museum, located on the beachfront, showcases artifacts from Vizag‚Äôs history. It provides diverse subjects for historical and cultural photography.
sources.shortName: Photography hotspots in Visakhapatnam

places.name: Visakha Museum

reviews.text:
Recently visited this place and it's a nice museum with a good mix of historical and maritime exhibits. It's a great spot to learn about Vizag's naval history, with interesting displays like old warship models, weapons, and even an unexploded WWII bomb. The place has an old-school charm, and it's definitely worth a visit if you're into history.

Entry Timings:
Monday to Thursday: 11:00 AM ‚Äì 7:00 PM
Friday: Closed
Saturday & Sunday: 12:00 PM ‚Äì 8:00 PM

Entrance Fee:
Entry fees are ‚Çπ10 for adults and ‚Çπ5 for children aged 5 to 12 years.

Less popular but the best museum  on the Beach Road, Ramakrishna Beach, close to the other three famous ( Submarine, Aircraft).
Beautiful models, history of naval forces of India since 2nd & third Century all are displayed very decently. No entry fees and you can visit the Anthropological museum adjacent to it. 2 hours is enogh. Some sitting and refresh arrangement may improve.

For me it is one of the best tourist spot of Vyzag. Though visiting museums always attracts me. And if you live spending time in museums, then you should visiti Visakha Museum, while in Visakhapatnam. Visakha museum: Maritime Museum and Heritage Museum. It is located on the RK beach road, Visakhapatnam. The museum has many models of planes, warships and submarines. The museum also houses the shell of a 250-lb unexploded bomb dropped by Japanese during the World War II. The photographs of Mahatma Gandhi walking with other prominent personalities of Vizag, the desk used by Gandhiji and later by Sri Tenneti Viswanadham can also be seen in this museum. It has great collections depicting the historical era of Vizag. This museum was inaugurated in the year 1991.
Visiting Hours: Monday- Friday: 11am to 7pm, Saturday -Sunday: 12pmnto 8pm.
Entry Fee: Adult: 10/-, Children: 5/-

sources.snippet: This abandoned ship docked at the shore gives a unique aesthetic to your pre-wedding shoot. It is a popular tourist attraction. The beach waves, the hill alongside and the wrecked ship certainly add a vibe to it.
sources.shortName: Picture perfect locations in Vizag for a romantic pre-wedding photoshoot

places.name: MV MAA Ship

reviews.text:
The MV MAA is an eerie yet intriguing sight along the shores of Visakhapatnam, a testament to the raw power of nature and the impermanence of man-made structures.

This Bangladeshi cargo ship ran aground during a cyclone in October 2020, leaving it stranded near the Tenneti Park beach.

The abandoned vessel has since become an unexpected tourist attraction, drawing curious visitors and photographers alike who are captivated by its rusting, massive structure juxtaposed against the tranquil sea.

The ship's presence is a stark reminder of the dangers faced by seafarers and adds a mysterious charm to Visakhapatnam's coastline.

This abundant ship is very beautiful, but the government is refurbishing the entire ship.And it does not look beautiful anymore. This abandoned ship is supposed to be of bangladesh and has been sitting here for quite some time. The real abandon shape and its rusty feel used to look very beautiful.But because of the current ongoing refurbishment done on the ship, it does not look that much attractive.
But one should not miss this place when in vishakhapatnam. This place can be visited during mornings or during the evenings as well.
Not much clealiness maintained by the authorities but this entire city and very beautiful and you would not want to miss visiting this place.

The vessel ‚ÄòMV MAA' is a cargo ship from Bangladesh which was abandoned in Andhra Pradesh and as the ship denied permission to dry dock and refloating attempts, the authorities thought of this. And now the ship has become a tourist attraction due to its proximity to the Tenneti Park in Andhra Pradesh. Visitors can see it closely from the Park, making it an ideal prospect for a floating restaurant or a hotel.üö¢üåä

places.generalDescription: Mangamaripeta Beach, situated near Vishakhapatnam, is a culturally and naturally rich destination. The beach boasts a Buddhist complex perched at a considerable height, attracting many visitors. It offers a serene environment to relax and enjoy the rhythmic waves. This popular beach also provides opportunities for water sports and features the stunning Mangamaripeta arch. Additionally, it holds historical significance as it was once a prominent center for Buddhism monks under the Kingdom of Kalingas.

sources.snippet: Vizag is a city that is lined with beaches popular with the tourists visiting the city. Mangamaripeta is one such beach that offers you not just the chance of dipping your toes in the water and building sandcastles but it also gives you an adrenaline rush with its water sports. Mangamripeta beach has a nature-made work of art making it highlights the beach known as the Mangamaripeta arch.
sources.shortName: Top 15 places to have a pre-wedding photo shoot at Vizag

sources.snippet: Vizag‚Äôs Mangamaripeta Beach is one of the city‚Äôs most prominent tourist attractions. Mangamaripeta Beach is one such beach that not only allows you to dip your toes in the ocean and construct sandcastles but also provides an adrenaline rush with its water sports. Mangamaripeta beach features a natural piece of art known as the Mangamaripeta arch, which serves to accentuate the beach.
sources.shortName: Top Shooting Locations in Visakhapatnam To Visit

sources.snippet: The Mangamaripeta Beach is most well known for its natural arch formation that provides a unique photo spot for gram lovers and in general, provides for a great hangout spot for visitors. Anyone getting a feel of Algarve, Portugal yet?

places.name: Mangamaripeta Beach

reviews.text:
Couldn't get the arch. Too many photo shoots.
Lovely beach and views

Beautiful beach with rock formations and  clean sand. The height of the road, palm trees, hills and wide parking area enhances the beauty of the Beach. But remember the beauty and cleanliness immediately vanishes if litter, plastic bags and food wastage thrown into the beach and surroundings. The beach is not very crowded, it is pristine and you will enjoy the natural Breeze here.

Quite different from the genuine beaches we know that are mostly cover with sand, this one marks itself by having numerous Rocky structures upon it which are flooded by the sea currents time after time.

places.generalDescription: Kailasagiri is an enchanting hilltop park that promises visitors stunning views of both the vibrant city and the serene Bay of Bengal. This tranquil oasis serves as a perfect retreat from urban life, where lush greenery envelops you in peace. The standout features are the impressive statues of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, which add a spiritual essence to your visit. Accessible via direct buses from the RTC complex in about 50 minutes, Kailasagiri welcomes you with an affordable entry fee.

sources.snippet: Reaching an altitude of 360 feet and located on a picturesque hill with a fantastic view of the sea, Kailasagiri Park offers a perfect treat to nature lovers and passionate photographers. It is a preferred picnic spot for families to have a great time and a favourite destination for filmmakers to shoot a movie scene or a new song.
sources.shortName: 3 Days in Visakhapatnam (Places to Visit in Three Days)

sources.snippet: The landmark hilltop park of Vizag, Kailasagiri is a great picnic spot to visit with family or friends. Take the cable car ride to the top of the hill which has a well-maintained and landscaped park and two huge Shiva and Parvati idols. Catch captivating views of the city beaches and forests from here.
sources.shortName: 23 Awesome Picnic Spots in and Around Vizag

sources.snippet: Kailasagiri is a famous hill station, which is surrounded by beaches and small hills. Kailasagiri Hill Park is located at the top and 360 feet from sea level. Road trains for children, ropeway trolleys and play park are some of the leading attractions here.
sources.shortName: 8 Stunning Places To Visit In Visakhapatnam

places.name: Kailasagiri

reviews.text: Kailash giri was turned in as a sudden surprise into my trip to Vizag. The view from it was pleasing. The core attraction is lord Shiva & mata Parvathi jis idols. There are certain activities for both children & adults. The place is well maintained with hygiene and also has parking standards. The view of the ocean was not less than magic. I had a good experience over here.

**Serene Hilltop Escape with Spiritual Charm**
Kailasagiri offers panoramic views of Visakhapatnam and the Bay of Bengal. The 40-foot Shiva and Parvati statues are a highlight, exuding tranquility. Visitors can enjoy a scenic ropeway ride, a toy train tour, and a floral clock. The park is well-maintained, making it ideal for families and couples seeking a peaceful retreat.
Only vehicle charges, for car we paid 50rs and there is no additional cost for public. Its good for children, as it has zipline and all. Adults can enjoy the view points and weather.

places.address: P8XV+9Q8, Kailasagiri, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530043, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled just 6 kilometers from the Vizag Railway Station, Vuda Park, also known as Taraka Rama Park, is a delightful oasis near RK Beach that beckons both locals and tourists. This enchanting park pays homage to the late Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Sri NT Rama Rao. Visitors can indulge in various activities such as boating and swimming while enjoying camel and horse rides.

sources.snippet: Providing the perfect mix of adventure and natural beauty, VUDA Park or the VRMDA Park is one of the popular Visakhapatnam tourist spots. Covered with thousands of trees, the park has surreal beauty beckoning tourists and locals alike. If that is not enough for you, the park offers some unique experiences like skiing, ice skating, a children‚Äôs play area, fitness centres and others.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: Located near RK beach, this is one of the popular places in Vizag that is definitely worth a visit. This is an urban park that was named after the then Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, N T Rama Rao at the time of its establishment. The park has recreational activities you can participate in along with an ice skating rink that has made its name all over the city.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Vizag (Visakhapatnam)

sources.snippet: Couples that like a garden environment will love Vuda Park, a verdant green area right in the middle of the city. The park offers a variety of photographic opportunities with its lovely landscaping, fountains, and strolling routes. Even though it can get busy, going early in the morning can help you avoid the crowds.
sources.shortName: Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Visakhapatnam: A Romantic Guide

sources.snippet: Among the tourist places near Vizag, VUDA Park is quite popular among tourists. An urban park that is well taken care of by the Visakhapatnam Urban Development Authority, VUDA Park is ideal for a lazy picnic. If you‚Äôre visiting with children, they can enjoy skating on the skating rink in the park.
sources.shortName: 23 Awesome Picnic Spots in and Around Vizag

sources.snippet: VUDA Park, also known as Taraka Rama Park, is a popular recreational park in Visakhapatnam. It features well-maintained gardens, a skating rink, a children‚Äôs play area, and boating facilities. The park is a favourite spot for families and kids, offering a variety of activities and attractions.
sources.shortName: 24 Best Offbeat Places in Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: 14 km from city center 11 out of 27 Places To Visit in Visakhapatnam. The Visakhapatnam Urban Development Authority or VUDA park, is a popular attraction in Visakhapatnam and a favorite amongst the tourists. One of its main attractions, here, is a musical waterfall.
sources.shortName: 27 Places to visit in Visakhapatnam 2024

sources.snippet: The lush greenery in VUDA Park is sure to elevate your spirits. The 2500 odd trees in 37 acres of land is sure to present you with rich greenery. The park measures 55 acres of land out of which, various species of plants are grown in 37 acres of land.
sources.shortName: 8 Stunning Places To Visit In Visakhapatnam

sources.snippet: A prominent tourist attraction in Vizag for adventure lovers, the VUDA park is a specialized adventure park in Vizag. It is now called the VRMDA park and has some of the unique experiences like skiing and heli tourism to travellers.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Visakhapatnam & Top Tourist Places

sources.snippet: Parks are yet another go-to place for pre-wedding photoshoots. Vuda Park in Vizag is a hotspot for these activities. This is a very scenic place for clicking photographs with all the greenery around.
sources.shortName: Picture perfect locations in Vizag for a romantic pre-wedding photoshoot

sources.snippet: Spanning 55 acres, VUDA Park has over 2,500 varieties of trees and numerous plants and flowers along with paved pathways overlooking the Bay of Bengal.
sources.shortName: 36 Places to Visit in Vishakhapatnam in 2024

places.name: Vuda Park

reviews.text:
VUDA Park, now officially known as VMRDA Park, is a
prominent urban park in Visakhapatnam, Andhra
Pradesh. Situated along the scenic Beach Road near
Ramakrishna Beach, it spans approximately 55 acres and
offers a variety of attractions for visitors
This park is beautiful park. There is a basketball stadium, boating, skating rink and an outdoor gym too. I recommend everyone to visit this place.
One of the best places in vizag with cool weather and excellent Ambience

places.address: 31-45-2, Vuda Colony, Kurmannapalem, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530049, India
